history.content:
Yes, however we only approve this exception for folks who graduate from both majors. If you were to drop the Math major in the future, you would need to complete CS 70. 

Are you taking CS 61A and CS 61B here on campus? Keep in mind we need at least two grades to calculate your GPA for declaration purposes.

children.subject: Currently, I'm taking CS61A and planned to take CS61B here on campus in next semester. I'm going to declare Applied Math this semester then hopefully be able to declare CS in the 2018 spring semester for a double major. Since I've got the credit for Math 55, will I receive any credit if I take CS70? Also, does that mean only the GPA for CS 61A and CS 61 B would be considered for declaration purposes?

history.content: I'm a junior transfer intend to double major in both applied math and CS. I'm currently enrolled in CS70, but I have taken math 55 equivalent from my community college. Am I able to use the equivalent math 55 from my CC to declare double major or do I have to take CS70?
history.subject: Math 55 as a prereq for Double Major in both CS/Applied Math
